PARAGRAPH.STRING: (or Pasu Sar, Pasu I) is a mountain peak in the Batura Muztagh, a sub-range of the Karakoram mountain range, located in the Gilgit District of the Northern Areas of Pakistan, west of the Hunza Valley.
is the high point of the Passu massif, which also includes Passu Diar (or "Passu East", "Pasu II").
lies on the main ridge of the Batura Muztagh, about 7 km (4 mi) east of Batura Sar.
was first climbed on August 7, 1994 by Max Wallner, Dirk Naumann, Ralf Lehmann, and Volker Wurnig.
